title: Mac issue of 7.9
body:
So I just updated my lol to 7.9 version on Mac.

The Client is running normally, but when I started the game, the new launch window jump out, I can only see and control 1/4 of the fullscreen, and the rest are all black.

need help ToT

replies.body:
A[ sticky post](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/nxyEq9WA-532017-14-screen-directx-error-issues) has been made with some solutions for players receiving a 1/4 screen or DirectX error!  

> **For Mac players**:  [Example screenshot here](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/302242899322601473/309346698331947018/Screen_Shot_2017-05-03_at_11.12.37_PM.png)
> 
> Tapping Alt+Enter in-game can serve as a work around.   This will toggle you out of fullscreen and into windowed mode to restore your game screen.

-----
> **For PC players**:  This may come up as a DirectX error
> 
> Delete your **Config folder**.  This  is typically found at C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\
> 
>As a heads up this will reset your resolution, settings, and keybindings to default.
> 

Thanks for the assist guys!

Based on what I've seen so far, it looks like most of the impacted players might be Mac users.  Some players have suggested changing your resolution in-game.  Has this helped?  

If the issue persists, download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to get some logs, and send a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech guys can start tracking these cases so we can investigate and figure out what's going on!

The issue I have now is with the low **frame rate**. And it seems to be two problems there: 

1. I used to have well over 100, now it seems to be capped at 60 (changing the capped frame rate to over 60 or to uncapped does nothing). I also tried disabling V-Sync and all that, disabled all eye candy, I set the graphics to low but no results. 

2. While most of the times the frame rate is at a constant 60 (doesn't even drop to 59), sometimes it goes way down for 2-3 seconds. And with no apparent reasons. It can happen while just walking alone in the jungle or on lane, without doing anything else (no casted spells or other funky animations), or it can happen during a team fight, and that sucks. This didn't happen before yesterday.

Hope it gets fixed soon. Good luck @Porocles.

_Edit: And an other thing that I observed is that now, when you minimize the game (Cmd+Tab), it first changes to window mode and after that gets minimized, and when you bring it up, it comes up in a window mode and automatically changes to fullscreen after. This didn't happen before. It's not a problem, but it is strange. And it might be related. _

Here's a screenshot of what it looks like.

I have NOT experienced this issue until the update that I did at approximately 7:30 pm CST, on Wednesday, May 3, 2017.

3/4 of my screen was black
If you divided my screen into 4 quadrants, the upper left, lower left, and lower right quadrants were all black.

Summoner's Rift seemed to also have been divided into four quadrants and only the lower left-hand quadrant was showing, but it was showing in 1/4 of my screen, the upper right-hand quadrant of my screen and it showed only the lower left-hand quadrant of Summoner's Rift. 

Another issue was that I could NOT move up the screen up. When I move my mouse the screen moves on Summoner's Rift, so I can pan the Rift. I could move the screen to the left, right, and down, but NOT up.

I was in full-screen mode when I went into the game. I thought to try a few things. This is the workaround that I came up with while I was in-game. 

While in-game, I pressed my escape key, which brought up the Options Screen. I then dragged the Options screen around with my mouse until I could see the Video tab. I then had to drag around the Options window with my mouse until I could see the Windowed Mode menu. My Windowed Mode was set to Full Screen, so I tried both Windowed and Borderless when I was in in-game. Both Windowed and Borderless seemed to be a workaround, and I saw the full four quadrants of my screen while I was in-game set to either the Windowed and Borderless setting, however, when Windowed Mode was set to Full Screen I only got that 1/4 of the bottom left-hand corner of the Rift showing in the upper right-hand quadrant of my screen. 

While in-game in with Windowed Mode was set Windowed or Borderless, I was able to move my mouse and pan around the Rift.

After the game ended I launched Practice mode to try out the three Windowed Mode options. When set to Windowed or Borderless I experienced what I saw in-game, however, when the Windowed Mode was set to Windowed or Borderless when I went into practice mode, (when I went into practice mode is the important thing here) this time I saw all four quadrants of my screen and I saw the Rift, however, the mouse still would only pan to the left, right, and down, and NOT up.

When I went into practice mode, (when I went into practice mode is the important thing here) with the game set to Full Screen mode, I got that 1/4 of the bottom left-hand corner of the Rift showing in the upper right-hand quadrant of my screen. 

So something's messed up when you go into a game with your Windowed Mode option set to Full Screen.

Going into a game with your Windowed Mode option set to either Windowed or Borderless seems to be the workaround.

Hi Guys,

So I am currently experiencing the same 1/4 screen problem. The quick fix is to use Alt + Enter once you get into the game (to get into windowed mode), once in windowed mode use Alt + Enter again (this should put you back into fullscreen mode).

Also, I was experiencing a problem where after I performed the steps above, I wasn't able to vertically move my screen around while in game. The solution to this problem is to then change your in game resolution back to 1440x900.

I'm playing on a 13" macbook pro, so you resolution might change depending on the size of you computer.

Hope this helps !
  
Best of luck,
